com.squareup.moshi

Class JsonAdapter<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.squareup.moshi.JsonAdapter<T>

  • public abstract class JsonAdapter<T>
extends Object
    Converts Java values to JSON, and JSON values to Java.

      • toJson

        public final String toJson(T value)

      • toJsonValue

        public final Object toJsonValue(T value)
        Encodes value as a Java value object comprised of maps, lists, strings, numbers, booleans, and nulls.

        Values encoded using value(double) or value(long) are modeled with the corresponding boxed type. Values encoded using value(Number) are modeled as a Long for boxed integer types (Byte, Short, Integer, and Long), as a Double for boxed floating point types (Float and Double), and as a BigDecimal for all other types.

      • fromJsonValue

        public final T fromJsonValue(Object value)
        Decodes a Java value object from value, which must be comprised of maps, lists, strings, numbers, booleans and nulls.

      • serializeNulls

        public final JsonAdapter<T> serializeNulls()
        Returns a JSON adapter equal to this JSON adapter, but that serializes nulls when encoding JSON.

      • nullSafe

        public final JsonAdapter<T> nullSafe()
        Returns a JSON adapter equal to this JSON adapter, but with support for reading and writing nulls.

      • lenient

        public final JsonAdapter<T> lenient()
        Returns a JSON adapter equal to this, but is lenient when reading and writing.

      • failOnUnknown

        public final JsonAdapter<T> failOnUnknown()
        Returns a JSON adapter equal to this, but that throws a JsonDataException when unknown values are encountered. This constraint applies to both the top-level message handled by this type adapter as well as to nested messages.

      • indent

        public JsonAdapter<T> indent(String indent)
        Return a JSON adapter equal to this, but using indent to control how the result is formatted. The indent string to be repeated for each level of indentation in the encoded document. If indent.isEmpty() the encoded document will be compact. Otherwise the encoded document will be more human-readable.
        Parameters:
        indent - a string containing only whitespace.
